meanings.definition: A person or thing that irritates or annoys.
meanings.sent1: The constant noise from the construction site next door is an irritator.
meanings.sent2: My little brother can be an irritator when he keeps asking questions.
meanings.sent3: The chirping bird outside my window became an irritator in the early morning.
meanings.sent4: Her persistent cough was like an irritator that wouldn't go away.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet was an irritator that echoed through the house.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used to provoke irritation or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The prank toy was an irritator that made funny noises when activated.
meanings.sent2: The automated phone calls were an irritator for many people.
meanings.sent3: The squirting flower on his shirt was an irritator that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The ticking clock was an irritator that seemed to mock his inability to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The itchy tag on his shirt was an irritator that he couldn't ignore.
